The Indonesian National Team had to settle for a draw against the Tanzanian National Team in a friendly match. The Garuda squad faced the Tanzanian National Team.
Controversial Points in the Broadcasting Bill
Controversial Points in the Broadcasting Bill

Previously, several parties had strongly criticized the discourse on revising the Broadcasting Law. The Press Council considers several points of the Broadcasting Bill to have the potential to restrict press freedom and produce poor journalistic products. Meanwhile, the Chairman of Commission I of the House of Representatives, Meutya Hafid, emphasized that her party has no intention of diminishing the role of the mass media through the Broadcasting Bill. Commission I of the House of Representatives is the party that has proposed the revision of the law from the beginning.

Meutya claimed to have a good relationship with stakeholders in the media industry, including the Press Council as a working partner of Commission I of the House of Representatives. According to her, the sustainability of a healthy media remains important.

"There has never been any intention from Commission I of the House of Representatives to diminish the role of the Press," she said in a written statement on Thursday (16/5). "I convey to all friends, from our faction, have instructed me to temporarily not discuss the Broadcasting Bill," said Supratman at the parliament complex, Monday (28/5).
